thread.title: American Legion, politicians honor Boys State, Girls State students
thread.title_full: American Legion, politicians honor Boys State, Girls State students

title: American Legion, politicians honor Boys State, Girls State students
text:
American Legion, politicians honor Boys State, Girls State students American Legion, politicians honor Boys State, Girls State students By Union Democrat staff October 01, 2015 10:36 pm American Legion member Bob Graves (left) stands with (from left) Tami Warnock, Kenneth Warnock, Garbrielle Icardo, Kristi Icardo and Karen Ross, WomenÂ’s Auxiliary chairwoman. Courtesy photo The American Legion Smyth-Bolter Post 54 recently honored students sponsored by the group who attended Boys State and Girls State this past summer. 
Students were invited to a regular meeting of the Legion to tell of their experiences. The two students who were able to attend were Gabrielle Icardo, who attended Girls State, and Kenneth Warnock, who attended Boys State. Students who were not able to attend were Lindsey Moore, Seth Farrell, Wyatt Faughnan and Benjamin Richardson. 
Icardo and Warnock said their time at each conference was rewarding and gave them an understanding of the workings of city and state government. Both were presented with a proclamation from Congressman Todd McClintock, and Boys State representatives received a proclamation from Assemblyman Frank Bigelow and Sen. Tom Berryhill while in Sacramento. The Girls State representatives were given the proclamation from Bigelow and Berryhill at the American Legion meeting. 
The Legion sponsors students to Boys and Girls State with money raised by a monthly pancake breakfast and an annual firewood raffle. Follow UnionDemocrat.com
